title: Drawing, "Royal Pavilion, Brighton", 1802 or earlier
medium: Brush and watercolor over graphite on white wove paper
provenance: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description: Design for a section of a wall showing a doorway surmounted by a painted rectangular panel decorated with a bird with colorful plumage.  A wideborder surrounds the panel.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Royal Pavilion, Brighton", 1802 or earlier.
1802 or earlier. Brush and watercolor over graphite on white wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane. 1948-40-21.
